arm_group.description: Self-guided training without app-based training (written hand-outs)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to investigate the effects of app-based self-directed ultrasound training
      compared to self-directed training with written handouts on subsequent performance on
      simulated patient cases and theoretical cases.

clinical_study.condition: Effectiveness of Self-guided Training, Assessed Via Ultrasound Performance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  First year medical doctor

          -  Provided written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  More than 10 independently performed scans

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Prompting Self-Regulated Learning Processes on App-Based Ultrasound Training. Study 1

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: The video-recordings of the technical performances are merged with the ultrasonography screen-recordings to one anonymized video-clip. These combined video-clips are rated with the OSAUS rating by two raters. The OSAUS scale (Objective Structured Assessment of Ultrasound Skills) is used for all performance assessments. The raters are consultant radiologists with experience in emergency ultrasonography.
primary_outcome.measure: Video recording of ultrasound skills, rated by consultant radiologists.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Ratings are to be completed within three months of performance.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants are given five videocases, to assess for eFAST verifiable pathology.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On site via checklist, evaluated on average one day after performance.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
